availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Richard J. Carr (Union County, Tennessee, physician, clerk)

body.p: Union County, Tennessee, merchant, physician, and court clerk. Tennessee native. Married to Nancy Ann Marshall Carr in Campbell County, Tennessee, on March 18, 1852. Father of Alonzo W. Carr, Adolphus C. Carr, Allison M. Carr, Albert O. Carr, and Asberry O. Carr. Merchant in Anderson County in 1850. Physician in Union County in 1860. Clerk of the Union Circuit Court in Union County in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Anderson County, p. 26A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Union County, p. 467.

_Tennessee Marriage Records, 1780-2002, Nashville, Tennessee, Cheatham County Marriages, p.112.
